metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35852 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description: In Suricata before 6.0.13 (when there is an adversary who controls an external source of rules), a dataset filename, that comes from a rule, may trigger absolute or relative directory traversal, and lead to write access to a local filesystem. This is addressed in 6.0.13 by requiring allow-absolute-filenames and allow-write (in the datasets rules configuration section) if an installation requires traversal/writing in this situation.

criterions.comment: suricata package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
